Thanks Nick for the latest changes and Patrick for the comments! I've merged this in now. This will be an awesome feature to have.
@dorx Could you add a unit test for this?

@rxin I changed this to only get the position twice (at the beginning and end), and also added metrics to NewHadoopRDD, which I'd forgotten about previously.  I also surrounded the calls to reader.getPos() with try/catch since they can throw exceptions.  This should be good to go now (and I verified it works for both Hadoop APIs on EC2).

@codeboyyong It is not mergable now. Do you mind merging the master branch and also create a separate PR for branch-0.9?
@mateiz @laserson This patched introduced a change which breaks the unit tests on Python 2.6. The `skipIf` feature is not supported until Python 2.7

Yes, that's annoying about python 2.6  Note that I just copied the same pattern that was present in `spark/python/pyspark/mllib/tests.py`.  One option would be to import `unittest2` if the interpreter is 2.6.
@laserson is it possible to just wrap the test in an "if statement"?
I guess that would work, though I've never seen anyone do that.  `unittest2` was created to backport all of the new functionality in `unittest` to py2.6.
FYI we've also been using skipIf for a while in python/pyspark/mllib/tests.py. I guess you're trying Jenkins on 2.6 now?
yes, maybe I don't make the version of test branch to be up-to-date at that time. I will close the issue.

@marmbrus I checked and remove the unneeded rules from `NullPropagation`.
Could you please check the changes?

@kayousterhout - I've fixed how we compute valid locality levels and added some unit test.
Now computeValidLocalityLevels considers a level as valid only if some executors are available to satisfy that level. And computeValidLocalityLevels is called every time new executor is added. (I'm not sure if it should also be called when executor is lost and when task finishes)
I also modified how the allowed locality is determined slightly. Now allowedLocality is set to maxLocality if allowedLocality is greater and maxLocality is a valid level to this TaskSetManager. This may help avoid the problem you mentioned earlier (when RACK_LOCAL is the only valid level and maxLocality starts from PROCESS_LOCAL).
Please help to review. Thanks.
Merged build finished. All automated tests passed.
